intro: Acrosynanthus jamaicensis, commonly known as the Jamaican acrosynanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Jamaica. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
